items.sentence: I have so much work to do that I have to put off my trip.
I hope this treaty will contribute to peace in the world.
I tried to answer the question, which I found impossible.
Tom said that he didn't know anything about the accident.
If Tom refuses to do it, someone else will have to do it.
I hope that I'm not the only one who's going to be there.
A bit of paint would make this room look a little better.
Mangos are sweet, they smell good, and they're delicious.
Tom should've told Mary why it was a bad idea to do that.
Please get plenty of sleep the day before donating blood.
My elbow really hurts. I guess I should go to a hospital.
Could you call my teacher and pretend that you're my dad?
I doubt that Tom can play the violin as well as Mary can.
One of my friends is getting married in Boston next week.
I'd expected to be able finish this work, but I couldn't.
There are no more vacant lots in my neighborhood anymore.
You may stay here if you like, as long as you keep quiet.
Whenever I see you, I always think of my younger brother.
Topless beaches are more common in Europe than in the US.
I don't think that Tom knows when Mary will visit Boston.
